4.Pros: The only pro i could think of is the discounted food other than that everything else is terrible.
4.Cons: Employees act like manager.Managers act like supervisors.If you are a male then you are expected to do every job but the one you applied for.Supervisor is almost always overly aggressive for no reason.Pay is bad.

5.Cons: low pay and not really fun

6.Pros: -Really easy to get shifts changed or take time off-My store manager and shift managers were easy to work with-Very easy to get a job there-Food safety protocols were easy to follow; Instructions were readily available
6.Cons: -Rush hours were consistently busy (Mostly on weekend lunches)-Had to decide whether to be a cook or counter/order taker; Only managers were cross-trained-Employee discount on food was only 30%; No free food-Very short breaks; 15 minutes for breaks, 30 minutes for lunch

7.Pros: Lots of potential benefits you can get. You can always find hours. Typically flexible with their hours. Always something new everyday and it's always interesting
7.Cons: If you request anything later than what they prefer you will not get it. You have to request everything early and keep reminding the manager(s).

8.Pros: Taste tests, free foundation drinks and coffee
8.Cons: Bad public reputation, and not much opportunity for growth

9.Pros: Discount meals, good training, nice company, good location, nice to meet new people, flexible hours, good experience, nice management, builds character
9.Cons: Rude customers, not always friendly coworkers, work holidays, not many breaks, lower pay than usual, smelling like the food, average
